column4: Alright, something fucked up has happened. Everything in /dev besides initctl and null is gone. I can't mount my cd drives because of it, and I fear that if I reboot it I won't be able to boot back in because I doubt it would be able to mount my hard drives. Anything I can do to fix this besides reinstalling?
This has also caused a weird error when initializing firefox or mozilla thunderbird: ./run-mozilla.sh: line 131: 24228 Segmentation fault      "$prog" ${1+"$@"}
udev is responsible for creating and removing stuff in /dev, so hey, give 'er.
no, I forgot to run it as root
and now I can't open another terminal
Or Alt+F2, then "xterm" .. that one might still run ... Alt+F7 to get back to X if you did the Ctrl+Alt+F1 idea.
Wow... I think Nintendud hit Ctrl+Alt+F1 before I could tell him about Alt+F7 :(
haha, didn't work, it just restarted my computer.. but restarting fixed it
